alert.note: Alert for Chaves (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued January 11 at 3:21PM MST until January 11 at 4:15PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Central Chaves County in southeastern New Mexico... * Until 415 PM MST. * At 318 PM MST, a dust storm was across southern Chaves County near Roswell. HAZARD...Less than a quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel, especially on US Highway 285 in and south of Roswell. Locations impacted include... Roswell, Dexter, Hagerman, Bitter Lake Wildlife Refuge, Bottomless Lakes State Park, Lake Arthur, Greenfield, Roswell Correctional Facility, and Midway. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... There is no safe place on a highway during a dust storm. Delay travel, or safely exit the highway before the dust storm arrives. Never stop in the traveled portion of the roadway. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
